comments:
When moving through the Events of a test log using the Next (right arrow) button in the Test Log viewer, the customer eventually gets: 

     An error had occurred.  See error log for more details. 

and the Error Log reports:

   Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in:  "/org.eclipse.jface".  

   Exception Stack Trace: 
   java.lang.NullPointerException at
   org.eclipse.hyades.test.ui.forms.base.ExecutionEventDetailsPart
   .setInput(ExecutionEventDetailsPart.java:643) 
   at org.eclipse.hyades.test.ui.forms.base.TypedEventDetailsPart
   .setInput(TypedEventDetailsPart.java:65) 
             ...

To reproduce the problem with the attached log (will attach as soon as I figure out how :-):
1. Import the attached project and display the Test Log of the "login" entry in the Performance Test Runs.
2. Go to the Events and expand User Group 1 and [User Group 1][000001].
3. Expand the SearchViewbyLOB, "test execution", and SearchViewbyLOB.
4. About 19 lines into this you'll see "Loop (2 iterations)[2]".  Expand this and then expand the seond entry in the loop ("[] (131560)"). 
5. Click on the final entry in this - "Destroy Window [][](131560)".
6. Repeatedly click on the Navigate to Next button (right arrow) at the top right of the Test Log.  After 22-25 clicks, the error dialog will appear.

This is reproducible each time and on separate installations.

Created an attachment (id=62007)
Test Log with the failure during navigation

This is the test log that your may use to reproduce this defect. Please follow the directions in the original defect description.
I think Bianca would be the right person for this defect.
Ashish, in which version of TPTP is this defect found?
Ashish, I couldn't reproduce it with your log file on the current 4.4 builds. So close as WORKSFORME for now.
Reporter: Please verify and close in preparation for shutting down the TPTP 4.4 release.  Thanks.
